reviewText: After Pope Francis visited Armenia, I wanted to know more.  Very interesting DVD.  I am not Armenian, but I am amazed at such resilience these people have.

I bought first o9ne and love it so I bought another for my freind, he loved it also. The video is very informative and well done with the history of Armenian. I am proud to say I am Armenian and this video was great to watch.

This is an excellent history of the Armenian people and their ability to survive despite incredible circumstances over the years.  The Armenians always survive and move on with or without a country.  Extraordinary. My grandfather survived the Hadjin massacres and made it to America eventually where he raised his family in peace.  His attitude says wonders about the Armenian people.  He never held anger just made the best that he could and always looked forward.

The Armenians: A Story of Survival is a good introduction to the people and their struggle to survive. Narrated by Olympia Dukakis, this documentary is a fine companion to The Armenian Genocide produced by Two Cats Productions.

A depressing story of how humans treat each other.  It is very well done and a part of history I knew nothing about.
Great film. Those who do not know history, are doomed to repeat it('s past mistakes)
As an Armenian, I found film interesting.
It was an interesting documentary about a  part of history I did not know about.
Interesting story of a people that have been persecuted throughout history.  Disappointing that it does not have closed caption since I'm hearing impaired.
History that I was never taught in school.
